title: BLISS Research Administrator
text:
Job Ref: 54694 
The main role for this post is to provide support for a large University of Birmingham research programme: The Birmingham Lung Improvement Studies, which is set in a Primary Care environment. Research Administrators will work directly with patients enrolled in the study. 
Benefits of employment Experience of working on a major health research project Clinical experience with patients To travel to participating general practice surgeries, within the West Midlands. To obtain informed consent and administer questionnaires to study participants To obtain study measurements, ensuring that the measurements are undertaken to high quality and in a timely manner. Performing spirometry, acquiring height and weight measurements, sit to stand test, grip strength and pulse oximetry. The post holder with have responsibility for setting up the equipment, cleaning and checking the equipment. To participate in data collection, management; and assist with data entry. To anticipate potential problems and identify ways to resolve them to ensure that the achievement of the research objectives are not adversely affected. 
Requirements 
Spirometry experience is essential. 
Candidates also must be able to pass an occupational health exam, a DBS check and be able to meet the travel requirements of the post 
Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK. 
This job would be ideal for candidates with a health-related degree but this is not essential as candidates with other experience, with or without higher education who enjoy working with people are also successful in this role. 
Informal Enquiries to: BLISS office on 0121 414 8348 or email bliss@contacts.bham.ac.uk 
To download the details of this position and submit an electronic application online please click on the Apply Online button below, please quote Job Reference in all enquiries. Alternatively information can be obtained from: www.hr.bham.ac.uk/jobs 
Fixed term until 31 May 2016 
Valuing excellence; sustaining investment
